page.title: 04Roehampton (1) The Village
page.content: Roehampton was once a village on the southwest outskirts of London, on the London to Portsmouth Road.In Roehampton today there are areas of different housing distinctly marked off from each other and each neighbourhood has its shops and Primary school.There is no Secondary school.Roehampton Community Council organises such activities as a People's Festival in June, a holiday project and a community newspaper. A large area, north of the village, was developed by a private company in the 1920's and much of it is very expensive housing.The 'village' is a Conservation Area and contains many attractive old buildings including the King's Head pub and the Montague Arms, and the country cottages in Medfield Street.People like living in Roehampton even though there are not many opportunities for employ- ment or leisure. (continued over)
